0: The grief-stricken mom of a 13-year-old girl who died suddenly during a game of tug-of-war at her Alabama school said Saturday that her daughter was full of life and “never met a stranger.” NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Sixth-grader Maddison Wentworth was playing Thursday with other students when she collapsed during an end-of-the-year Field Day event at Williams Intermediate in Pell City, according to authorities. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Leslie Wentworth told FoxNews.com she was at work when the school called and said her daughter may have suffered a seizure. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR “I’m pulling my strength from God,” she said. “The love I’ve received from the community has just been overwhelming.” NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Wentworth said Maddison’s death was a shock. She said her daughter had no known health problems. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR School nurses administered CPR until paramedics arrived. Maddison was taken to a local hospital where she was pronounced dead. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Pell City Police Sgt. Don Newton told Al.com paramedics continued to work on Maddison on the way to the hospital. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR She was pronounced dead at 12:34 p.m., the news outlet reported. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR An autopsy was scheduled to determine the cause of death, AL.com reported. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "We have suffered a great loss at Williams Intermediate School. Field day is supposed to be one of the best days of the year,” Pell City Schools Superintendent Michael Barber said in a statement. “Our thoughts and prayers are with the family, and with the faculty and students who knew her and loved her every day. And I would ask everyone to keep this family and the system in their prayers as well." NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Classmates wrote notes to Maddison during school Friday and put them in her locker, Fox 6 News reported. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The notes will be given to her mother, according to the station. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The school was also planning to hold a “celebration of life” event in honor of Maddison on the last day of school next week, Fox 6 reported. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR A GoFundMe account has been established to “help with the financial side of this horrific time” in the lives of the girl’s family. As of early Saturday, more than $2,500 has been raised to help the family. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Click for more from Al.com. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Click for more from Fox 6 News.
